item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 17, 2024 at 9:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. All-in-one embedding model for interleaved text, images, and screenshots (28 points | discuss)
2. CSS gets a new logo and it uses the color `rebeccapurple` (315 points | 42 comments)
3. The Bluesky firehose viewed in the style of a Windows XP screensaver (237 points | 63 comments)
4. James Gleick's Chaos: The Software (132 points | 12 comments)
5. Show HN: I built a(nother) house optimized for LAN parties (631 points | 232 comments)
6. Teach yourself to echolocate (140 points | 31 comments)
7. SICP: The only computer science book worth reading twice? (2010) (322 points | 126 comments)
8. My Kidney Donation (15 points | 6 comments)
9. King Arthur's ancient trail across Britain (17 points | 9 comments)
10. Effect of a giant meteorite impact on Paleoarchean environment and life (107 points | 42 comments)
11. Two galaxies aligned in a way where their gravity acts as a compound lens (214 points | 64 comments)
12. James Webb Space Telescope finds evidence for alternate theory of gravity (279 points | 117 comments)
13. Logica – Declarative logic programming language for data (119 points | 46 comments)
14. Appreciation of the mark-all-as-read button (27 points | 8 comments)
15. Statistical Rethinking (2024 Edition) (134 points | 22 comments)
16. Bulk Image Search with Google Lens (6 points | discuss)
17. Yggdrasil Network (264 points | 91 comments)
18. I tried every top email marketing tool (164 points | 80 comments)
19. One-parting some Commodore 64 utilities for fun and profit (15 points | 1 comment)
20. When Abstractions Break (12 points | 2 comments)
21. Resolving a mysterious problem with find (14 points | 11 comments)
22. Xogot – Godot for iPad (73 points | 13 comments)
23. Restart of Three Mile Island tests US appetite for nuclear revival (3 points | discuss)
24. Discord API Errors (29 points | 15 comments)
25. Two Nobel Prize winners want to cancel their own CRISPR patents in Europe (62 points | 30 comments)
26. SmoothLLM: Defending Large Language Models Against Jailbreaking Attacks (35 points | 12 comments)
27. Optimizers: The Low-Key MVP (102 points | 7 comments)
28. Numpyro: Probabilistic programming with NumPy powered by Jax (89 points | 21 comments)
29. The decline and fall of the British economy (2022) (68 points | 66 comments)
30. Don't Look Twice: Faster Video Transformers with Run-Length Tokenization (60 points | 9 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 17, 2024 at 9:15 AM UTC
